MASABlazorDescription: Provide standard basic component library based on the interaction ability of Material Design and BlazorComponent. It provides preset components for standard scenarios such as layout, pop-up frame standard, loading, global exception handling, etc.
VideoDesc: The video presentation content will create the project in three ways, including creating a blazor server using the MASA Blazor template, Blazor Wasm, and manually adding MASA Blazor.
RichComponentsDesc: In addition to 1:1 restoration with the basic components of Vuetify, there are also many useful preset components
UIDesignLanguageDesc: The design style is modern and the UI experience is excellent
LongTermSupportDesc: Full time team maintenance, long-term support. Weekly release
EasyToUseDesc: Extremely rich and detailed start-up documents, details are in place, free video tutorials
CommunityActiveDesc: User participation, real-time interaction, make contributions, join us and build the most open open source community
RelatedArticle1: Teach you to learn more about dapr 1. The era of .Net developers
RelatedArticle2: Teach you to learn more about dapr 2. Must know concept
RelatedArticle3: Teach you to learn more about dapr 3. Run the first. Net program using dapr
RelatedArticle4: Teach you to learn more about dapr 2. Service invocation

all-components.alerts: Alerts convey important information to the user
all-components.application: Optional root component used to easily modify theme
all-components.aspect-ratios: The aspect ratio component enforces a defined ratio
all-components.avatars: Alerts convey important information to the user
all-components.badges: Badges superscript or subscript an avatar-like icon or text onto content
all-components.banners: Banners are used to communicate important information to the user
all-components.app-bars: The app bar is used for top level navigation items and current page actions
all-components.tool-bars: Typically used to hold navigation items or actions
all-components.system-bars: The system bar component shows application information with iconography, time, and more
all-components.block-text: Display two data of the same type side by side
all-components.borders: The Border component can add an extra border to anything
all-components.bottom-navigation: The bottom navigation component is used for displaying navigation links on mobile
all-components.bottom-sheets: Pop up window that slides out from the bottom of the screen
all-components.breadcrumbs: Breadcrumbs are navigational helpers for router pages
all-components.buttons: The button component allows users to take actions or make choices with a single tap
all-components.cards: The Cards component is a versatile component that can be used for anything from a panel to a static image
all-components.carousels: Carousels are used to display multiple forms of visual content
all-components.chips: Chips are useful for displaying small pieces of information
all-components.copyable-text: Append a button that provides copy feature to the content
all-components.dialogs: The dialog component is used for displaying critical information
all-components.dividers: The Dividers component is used to separate sections of lists or layouts
all-components.drag-zone: The DragZone component is based on Sorttable.js to implement drag and drop functionality
all-components.editor: Rich text editor based on Quill encapsulation
all-components.error-handler: The ErrorHandler component is used to handle exception information when the blazor component data is loaded and rendered
all-components.expansion-panels: The MExpansionPanel component is useful for reducing vertical space with large amounts of information
all-components.floating-action-buttons: The Button component can be used as a floating action button
all-components.footers: The footer component is a simple navigation area with inner site links
all-components.autocompletes: The Autocompletes component offers simple and flexible type-ahead functionality
all-components.checkboxes: The Checkboxs component provides users the ability to choose between two distinct values
all-components.file-inputs: The FileInputs component is a specialized input that provides a clean interface for selecting files
all-components.forms: When it comes to form validation, MASA Blazor has a multitude of integrations and baked in functionality
all-components.opt-input: The OTP input is used for MFA procedure of authenticating users by a one-time password
all-components.radio: The radio component is a replacement for its native counterpart
all-components.range-sliders: The RangeSliders component is a better visualization of the number input. It is used for gathering numerical user data
all-components.selects: The Select component is used for collecting user provided information from a list of options
all-components.sliders: The Sliders component is a better visualization of the number input. It is used for gathering numerical user data
all-components.switches: The Switchs component provides users the ability to choose between two distinct values
all-components.textareas: Textareas components are used for collecting large amounts of textual data
all-components.text-fields: Text fields components are used for collecting user provided information
all-components.grids: The grid is used to create specific layouts within an application’s content
all-components.button-groups: The ButtonGroups component is a simple wrapper for MItemGroup built specifically to work with MButton
all-components.chip-groups: The ChipGroups supercharges the MChip component by providing groupable functionality
all-components.item-groups: The ItemGroups provides the ability to create a group of selectable items out of any component
all-components.list-item-groups: The ListItemGroups provides the ability to create a group of selectable MListItem
all-components.slide-groups: The SlideGroups component is used to display pseudo paginated information
all-components.windows: The Windows component provides the baseline functionality for transitioning content from 1 pane to another
all-components.hover: The Hover component provides a clean interface for handling the hover state of any component
all-components.icons: The Icons component provides a large set of glyphs to provide context to various aspects of your application
all-components.images: The Images component is packed with features to support rich media
all-components.infinite-scroll: Scrolling to the bottom of the list automatically loads more data
all-components.lists: The list component is a display interface for items
all-components.menus: The Menus component shows a menu at the position of the element used to activate it
all-components.mobile-cascader: A cascade selector designed for the mobile
all-components.mobile-date-pickers: A date picker designed for the mobile
all-components.mobile-date-time-pickers: A date picker designed for the mobile
all-components.mobile-pickers: A picker designed for the mobile
all-components.mobile-picker-views: A picker designed for the mobile
all-components.mobile-time-pickers: A time picker designed for the mobile
all-components.modals: When requiring users to interact with the application, but without jumping to a new page and interrupting the user's workflow, you can use Modal to create a new floating layer over the current page to get user feedback or display information
all-components.navigation-drawers: Navigation drawers contain primary application navigation links
all-components.overlays: The Overlays component is used to provide emphasis on a particular element or parts of it
all-components.pagination: The Pagination component is used to separate long sets of data
all-components.date-pickers: DatePickers is a fully featured date selection component that lets users select a date, or range of dates
all-components.date-pickers-month: DatePicker can be used as a standalone month picker component
all-components.time-pickers: The MTimePicker is stand-alone component that can be utilized in many existing MASA Blazor components
all-components.progress-circular: The component is used to display circular data to users. It also can be put into an indeterminate state to portray loading
all-components.progress-linear: The component is used to convey data circularly to users. It also can be put into an indeterminate state to portray loading
all-components.ratings: Ratings are useful for collecting user feedback
all-components.sheets: The Sheets component is the baseline for numerous components such as MCard, MToolbar, and more
all-components.skeleton-loaders: The SkeletonLoaders component is a versatile tool that can fill many roles within a project
all-components.snackbars: The Snackbars component is used to display quick messages to users
all-components.steppers: The Steppers component displays progress through numbered steps
all-components.subheaders: The Subheaders component is used to separate sections of lists
all-components.data-iterators: The DataIterators component is used for displaying data, and shares a majority of its functionality with the MDataTable component
all-components.data-tables: The DataTables component is used for displaying tabular data
all-components.simple-tables: The SimpleTables component is a simple wrapper component around the <table> element
all-components.tabs: The Tabs component is used for hiding content behind a selectable item
all-components.timelines: Timelines is very useful for displaying chronological information
all-components.toast: The component is used to convey important information to the user through the use contextual types icons and color
all-components.tooltips: The Tooltips component is useful for conveying information when a user hovers over an element
all-components.treeview: The Treeview component is useful for displaying large amounts of nested data.
all-components.virtual-scroller: The VirtualScroller component displays a virtual、infinite list
